messages.content: What is One Button Prompt?

One Button Prompt is a tool or script for Automatic1111, ComfyUI, and RuinedFooocus that generates an entire prompt from scratch for Stable Diffusion, allowing users to create images with the click of a button.
Which models is One Button Prompt best used with?
One Button Prompt is best used with all-purpose models such as Stable Diffusion 1.5 or SDXL type models, but can be used with other personal favorite models as well.
How can One Button Prompt be integrated with ComfyUI?

One Button Prompt can be integrated with ComfyUI as a custom node. Installation instructions can be found in the user guide: https://github.com/AIrjen/OneButtonPrompt/blob/main/user_guides/comfyui_integration.md
What is the recommended range for the insanity level slider in One Button Prompt?
The recommended range for the insanity level slider is between 3-7, with 10 being usable at your own risk.
Can One Button Prompt generate prompts for specific subjects chosen by the user?
Yes, One Button Prompt allows users to create infinite variations of a chosen subject by filling in the Overwrite subject field.
How does the Smart subject feature work in One Button Prompt?
The Smart subject feature tries to determine what to generate based on the user's subject, recognizing keywords and adjusting the generated prompt accordingly.
What is the Workflow assist tab in One Button Prompt used for?
The Workflow assist tab is designed to help users adjust and maintain prompts without turning off the extension, allowing them to create prompt variants and manage their workflow more efficiently.
What is the purpose of One Button Run and Upscale in One Button Prompt?

One Button Run and Upscale allows users to generate an image with TXT2IMG, upscale the image with IMG2IMG, enable a quality gate for selecting the best images, and use their own prompts, all with a single button press.
What is the new mode introduced in One Button Prompt?
The new mode introduced in One Button Prompt is the Anime Model Mode, which supports anime model prompting.
What is the recommended setting for the 'Insanitylevel' when using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode?
The recommended setting for the 'Insanitylevel' when using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode is between 4-6.
What should be set for the 'Artists' option when using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode?
The 'Artists' option should be set to 'none' when using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode, as artists are all SD based and may interfere and create bad results.
What is the recommended setting for the 'Imagetype' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode?
The recommended setting for the 'Imagetype' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode is 'all - anime'.
What are some suggested settings for the 'Subjecttype' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode?
Some suggested settings for the 'Subjecttype' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode are 'human - all', 'human - fictional', or any other based on user preference.
What does the 'Gender' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode allow users to choose?
The 'Gender' option in One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode allows users to choose between males, females, or both (by selecting 'All').
What should be included in the 'Prompt prefix' field when using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode for AnimagineXL?
When using One Button Prompt's Anime Model Mode for AnimagineXL, the 'Prompt prefix' field should include 'masterpiece, best quality, very aesthetic, absurdres'.
What is the purpose of the Auto Negative Prompt feature in OneButtonPrompt?
The Auto Negative Prompt feature in OneButtonPrompt aims to improve the results of prompts by automatically generating a negative prompt that inverts some words from the original prompt.
How does the Auto Negative Prompt feature generate negative prompts?

The Auto Negative Prompt feature parses the original prompt and tries to invert some words. For example, if the original prompt contains 'anime', it will add 'photorealistic' to the negative prompt, and if it contains 'colorful', it will add words like 'drab' and 'monochrome' to the negative prompt.
What is the default setting for the Auto Negative Prompt feature in A1111?
In A1111, the Auto generate negative prompt option is turned on by default.
What does the 'Enable base enhancement prompt' option do in the Auto Negative Prompt feature?
The 'Enable base enhancement prompt' option adds a bunch of quality-enhancing statements to the negative prompt. By default, this option is turned off.
How does the 'Randomness of negative prompt' setting affect the generated negative prompt?

Increasing the 'Randomness of negative prompt' value will remove more parts of the negative prompt. A setting of 5 will randomly remove about 50% of the negative prompt. By default, this setting is turned off and set to a value of 0.
What is the purpose of the 'Base negative prompt' option in the Auto Negative Prompt feature?
The 'Base negative prompt' option allows users to add their normal negative prompt, which will be fully added at the end of the generated negative prompt.
Is the Auto Negative Prompt feature available as a ComfyUI Node?
Yes, the Auto Negative Prompt feature is available as a ComfyUI Node.
What is One Button Prompt?
One Button Prompt is a ComfyUI extension that generates prompts from scratch or based on several inputs and settings. It can replace the Positive Prompt node in any workflow.
How can One Button Prompt be installed in ComfyUI?
One Button Prompt can be installed in ComfyUI through the ComfyUI manager or manually by cloning the GitHub repository into the ComfyUI/custom_nodes/ directory and restarting ComfyUI.
What is the purpose of the One Button Artify node?
The One Button Artify node works as an artist mixer for prompts in ComfyUI. It allows adding styles of various artists known in Stable Diffusion to the prompt.
How does the One Button Flufferize node enhance prompts?

The One Button Flufferize node enhances prompts by adding quality tags at the end of the prompt, similar to Fooocus Prompt Magic. It has options like dynamic, none, short, medium, and long for controlling the enhancement.
What is the function of the Create Prompt Variant node?

The Create Prompt Variant node creates variants of a given prompt based on the insanity level slider setting. It can be connected between the positive prompt and the CLIP encoder module in ComfyUI workflows.
How does the Save Prompt To File node work in ComfyUI?
The Save Prompt To File node in ComfyUI saves the generated prompt to a text file. It can be connected to the output of the One Button Prompt node and the Positive Prompt node in the workflow.
What is the purpose of the Auto Negative Prompt node?

The Auto Negative Prompt node generates a negative prompt based on the input positive prompt. It enhances the positive prompt by adding terms like 'photorealistic' to the negative prompt if 'anime' is in the positive prompt.
What are the available options in the Auto Negative Prompt node?

The Auto Negative Prompt node has options like base_negative, which adds terms to the negative prompt, enhancenegative, which pushes quality-enhancing terms, and insanitylevel, which controls the number of terms in the negative prompt.
What file is created by OneButtonPrompt after the first startup?
After the first startup, OneButtonPrompt creates a config.csv file in the /userfiles/ folder.
How can you restore the config.csv file if you make a mistake?
If you make a mistake or wish to fully restore the config.csv file, simply remove it. OneButtonPrompt will recreate the file.
What can you set in the config.csv file?
In the config.csv file, you can set what to generate and the randomness of certain parts of the generation process.
What should you do to update the UI after making changes to the config.csv file?
To update the UI after making changes to the config.csv file, you might need to restart WebUI.
How can you turn off specific subjects within a group in the config.csv file?

In the config.csv file, you can turn off specific subjects within a group by setting the corresponding subject option to 'off'. If you turn off all subjects within a group, it turns the main group off.
What are the options available for setting the random chance of something appearing in the prompt?

The options available for setting the random chance of something appearing in the prompt are, in order of increasing appearance: always, common, normal, uncommon, rare, legendary, unique, extraordinary, novel, and never.
How can you overwrite the default config of OneButtonPrompt?

You can overwrite the default config of OneButtonPrompt by changing the corresponding option in the config.csv file. For example, to always generate a pose, change 'posechance;uncommon' to 'posechance;always'.
What is the purpose of the /userfiles/ directory in OneButtonPrompt?
The /userfiles/ directory in OneButtonPrompt is used to include personal additions and overwrites such as LoRA's, textual inversions, artist lists, custom lists, and an antilist.
How can you add style LoRA's and textual inversions in OneButtonPrompt?

To add style LoRA's and textual inversions in OneButtonPrompt, you need to fill the __styles_ti_lora.csv__ file in the /userfiles/ directory with the appropriate values. The corresponding TI or LoRA needs to be installed for it to work.
How can you maintain your own personal favorite artists lists in OneButtonPrompt?

To maintain your own personal favorite artists lists in OneButtonPrompt, you can add any number of files named as __personal_artists_xyz.csv__ (replace xyz with the name of your choice) in the /userfiles/ directory. These lists will show up in the artists selection in OneButtonPrompt.
What are the two ways to modify the main lists in OneButtonPrompt?

In OneButtonPrompt, you can modify the main lists by either adding to them using a file named __listname_addon.csv__ or replacing them using a file named __listname_replace.csv__ in the /userfiles/ directory.
How can you add custom lists in OneButtonPrompt?

In OneButtonPrompt, you can add custom lists by creating files named __custom_input_prefix.csv__, __custom_input_mid.csv__, or __custom_input_suffix.csv__ in the /userfiles/ directory. These lists will be randomly used in the prompt generation at the front, middle, or end of the prompt respectively.
What is the purpose of the antilist.csv file in OneButtonPrompt?

The antilist.csv file in OneButtonPrompt is used to remove specific values from any list or csv file used during prompt generation. Any value added to this file will be excluded from the generated prompts.
How can you load a subject from a file with a special wildcard in OneButtonPrompt?

In OneButtonPrompt, you can load a subject from a file by placing a file called custom_subjects.csv in the user_files folder. By using the -subjectfromfile- wildcard in the Overwrite Subject field, a random value will be selected from this file.
What is OneButtonPrompt?
OneButtonPrompt is a tool or script in ComfyUI that helps generate random image prompts with various settings to create different styles and types of images using stable diffusion models.
Which models work best with OneButtonPrompt?
OneButtonPrompt works best with more general and multi-purpose models such as deliberate and dreamlike diffusion. However, it can also be used with other models trained on specific subjects.
How can you generate images in a specific style or model using OneButtonPrompt?

To generate images in a specific style or model, you can set the 'Subject Type', 'Artists', and 'Type of image' parameters accordingly in OneButtonPrompt. You can also add trigger words for certain models in the prompt prefix field.
What settings were used to generate portrait images using the deliberate model in the example?

In the portrait example using the deliberate model, the following settings were used: Sampling method set to 'DPM++ SDE Karras', Sampling steps to '25', CFG Scale to '6', 'Subject Type' set to 'humanoid', 'Artists' set to 'popular', and 'Type of image' set to 'portrait'.
How can you generate photo images using OneButtonPrompt?

To generate photo images, you can use a model like Realistic Vision, set 'Subject Type' to 'humanoid', 'Artists' to 'photograph', and 'Type of image' to 'portrait'. You can also try using 'fashion' or 'none' as the artist.
How can you add trigger words for certain models in OneButtonPrompt?
You can add trigger words for certain models by placing them in the prompt prefix field in OneButtonPrompt. This field will always be added to the beginning of the generated prompt.
How can you generate images in the style of a specific artist using OneButtonPrompt?

To generate images in the style of a specific artist, set 'Artists' to 'none', overwrite 'Type of image' with your desired style, and add the artist's name in the prompt suffix field. For example, 'art by Loish' can be added to generate images in Loish's style.
What are One Button Presets in ComfyUI?
One Button Presets are saved generation settings in ComfyUI that can be instantly loaded up for One Button Prompt. Users can also save their own presets.
How can you access all settings for One Button Presets?
To access all settings for One Button Presets, you need to set the One Button Preset to 'Custom...'.
What is the purpose of the 'Standard' preset in One Button Presets?
The 'Standard' preset is the default preset for One Button Prompt. It is wild and unpredictable, making it good for prompt exploration.
Which preset is suitable for generating photographic people portraits?
The 'Unique People Portraits' preset focuses on generating photographic people portraits.
What is the 'Greg mode - The Preset' preset designed for?
The 'Greg mode - The Preset' preset is designed to focus on creating characters mixed with popular artists like Greg Rutkowski. It works best on SD 1.5 models.
How can you save a new preset in One Button Presets?
To save a new preset, type the desired name in the preset name field and press 'Save as preset'. This will save the new preset and remove all options again.
Where are the One Button Presets stored?
The One Button Presets are stored in the /userfiles/ folder in JSON format. The file is named obp_presets.json and is created on first startup.
What is the main feature of OneButtonPrompt?

The main feature of OneButtonPrompt is the ability to generate an image with TXT2IMG, upscale that image with IMG2IMG, upscale with EXTRAS, and the possibility to just batch upscale existing images, all with a single press of One Button.
What is the purpose of the Quality Gate functionality in OneButtonPrompt?

The Quality Gate functionality in OneButtonPrompt allows the user to set a quality score and amount of tries. The process repeats until an image reaches the quality score or the amount of tries is reached. This ensures that only the best images are selected for upscaling.
What is the requirement to use the Quality Gate functionality in OneButtonPrompt?
To use the Quality Gate functionality in OneButtonPrompt, you need to install the image-scorer extension into WebUI.
What are the different methods of upscaling supported by OneButtonPrompt?
OneButtonPrompt supports SD Upscale, Ultimate SD Upscale, and Controlnet tile_resample methods of upscaling.
What is the purpose of the 'Don't generate, only upscale' option in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'Don't generate, only upscale' option in OneButtonPrompt skips the TXT2IMG part of the batch and starts batch upscaling the images placed in the 'upscale_me' folder with the set parameters.
How can a user use their own prompts instead of the One Button Prompt generator in OneButtonPrompt?

To use their own prompts in OneButtonPrompt, the user needs to enable 'Workflow mode' in the 'Workflow assist' tab, put their prompt in the 'Workflow prompt' field, and put the negative prompt in the 'Use this negative prompt' field in the 'Main' tab.
What is the benefit of using the 'Just Upscale mode' in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'Just Upscale mode' in OneButtonPrompt is perfect for users who generate their images via TXT2IMG and then want to upscale the best results automatically in a batch.
What is OneButtonPrompt?
OneButtonPrompt is a tool that allows users to generate variations of a subject in ComfyUI by overriding the subject and adjusting settings.
How does the 'Overwrite Subject' setting work in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'Overwrite Subject' setting allows users to input any text that will be treated as the subject to generate, guiding the prompt generation based on the chosen 'Subject Type'.
What is the purpose of the 'Smart Subject' setting in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'Smart Subject' setting interprets the user's prompt and turns off any related lists to focus the generation on the desired subject and attributes.
How can users create infinite variations of a set subject using OneButtonPrompt?

Users can create infinite variations of a set subject by overriding the subject, adjusting settings like 'Subject Types', 'Artists', and 'type of image', and utilizing features such as 'subject magic' and wildcards.
What is 'subject magic' in OneButtonPrompt?

Subject magic is a feature in OneButtonPrompt that allows users to use the magic word 'subject' in the override subject field, which acts as a wildcard and replaces the intended subject during the generation process.
How can users generate images with specific attributes using OneButtonPrompt?

Users can generate images with specific attributes by using keywords in the override subject field, such as 'hair', 'wearing', 'pose', and 'lighting', which turn off related lists and focus on the desired attributes.
What are wildcards in OneButtonPrompt?

Wildcards in OneButtonPrompt are special placeholders that can be used in the prompt prefix, prompt suffix, and subject override fields, which get values from their specific related lists to add variety to the generated images.
What is the purpose of the Prompt Compounder in OneButtonPrompt?
The Prompt Compounder in OneButtonPrompt allows users to generate multiple prompts and combine them together to create more complex and varied image generations.
How can you create interesting landscape images using OneButtonPrompt and the Regional Prompter extension?

To create interesting landscape images using OneButtonPrompt and the Regional Prompter extension, set the Subject Type to 'landscape' and Artists to 'vibrant' in OneButtonPrompt. Then, load the 'Horizontal-3' Preset in Regional Prompter, enable 'Use common prompt', and set the Base Ratio to '0.4'. Set the Prompt Compounder to 3, the Prompt separator to 'BREAK', and the Prompt separator mode to 'automatic' in the Advanced tab of OneButtonPrompt.
What are the recommended settings for creating insanity with Regional Prompter and OneButtonPrompt?

To create fantastical results using Regional Prompter and OneButtonPrompt, use the 'Twod-2-1' preset in Regional Prompter, enable 'Use common prompt', and set the Base Ratio to '0.4'. In OneButtonPrompt, set the Prompt Compounder to 3, the Prompt separator to 'BREAK', and the Prompt separator mode to 'automatic'.
How can you create a 'two shot' with multiple different people using OneButtonPrompt?

To create a 'two shot' with multiple people using OneButtonPrompt, set the Subject Types to 'humanoid', Artist to 'none', and type of image to 'photograph'. Set the prompt prefix to 'art by brandon woelfel, two people'. In Regional Prompter, set the Divide Ratio to '1,1', Split mode to 'Horizontal', enable 'Use common prompt', and set the Base Ratio to '0.7'. Set the Prompt Compounder to 2, the Prompt separator to 'BREAK', and the Prompt separator mode to 'prefix AND prompt + suffix' in OneButtonPrompt.
What is the Prompt separator and what is its purpose in OneButtonPrompt?

The Prompt separator is a feature in OneButtonPrompt that allows users to separate multiple prompts using a specific keyword, such as 'BREAK'. This is particularly useful when using Regional Prompter, as it helps in dividing the generated prompts for different areas of the image.
How does the Prompt separator mode 'automatic' work in OneButtonPrompt?

When the Prompt separator mode is set to 'automatic' in OneButtonPrompt, it generates a common prompt that consists of an artist and the type of image the user wants to create. It also disables any other artists generated in the normal prompts, ensuring the focus remains on the desired style and image type.
What is the recommended resolution for generating images with OneButtonPrompt and Regional Prompter when creating insanity with the 'Twod-2-1' preset?
The recommended resolution for generating images with OneButtonPrompt and Regional Prompter when creating insanity with the 'Twod-2-1' preset is 1200x1200.
What is OneButtonPrompt?
OneButtonPrompt is a tool that generates prompts for image generation, offering various prompt generation modes to inspire users and create diverse image styles.
How many different prompt generation modes are available in OneButtonPrompt?
There are currently 9 different prompt generation modes available in OneButtonPrompt.
What is the purpose of the 'One in X chance to use special image type mode' slider in OneButtonPrompt?

The 'One in X chance to use special image type mode' slider controls how often the special image generation modes appear. A lower value means they appear more often, while a value of 1 means a random special generation mode will always be selected.
What is the focus of the 'art blaster mode' in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'art blaster mode' in OneButtonPrompt focuses on art movements, stylings, and artists to generate prompts best suited for models that can handle those artists.
What kind of image style does the 'color cannon mode' in OneButtonPrompt favor?
The 'color cannon mode' in OneButtonPrompt favors color schemes and moods in the generated prompts, but it does not always mean bright colors.
How does the 'quality vomit mode' in OneButtonPrompt generate prompts?
The 'quality vomit mode' in OneButtonPrompt generates prompts by focusing on qualifiers and stylings, adding words like 'masterpiece,' 'high quality,' and styling descriptions to the prompt.
In OneButtonPrompt's 'unique art mode,' what types of art and stylings are emphasized?
In OneButtonPrompt's 'unique art mode,' the prompts generated emphasize other image types, art movements, stylings, and lighting, such as stained glass or ice sculptures.
What is the purpose of the 'subject only mode' in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'subject only mode' in OneButtonPrompt generates prompts that only include the subject, without additional details, best used for models with strong built-in art styles.
What is RuinedFooocus?
RuinedFooocus is a great Fooocus fork that has One Button Prompt built in.
Where can One Button Prompt be found in RuinedFooocus?
One Button Prompt can be found under the One Button tab in RuinedFooocus.
What are the main differences between One Button Prompt in RuinedFooocus and other versions?

In RuinedFooocus, there is currently no way to generate directly. You need to add the prompts to the prompt field first. The Instant OPB button adds the prompt to the prompt field and starts generating right away, while the Create Random Prompt adds the prompt to the prompt field, and the Add To Prompt adds an additional prompt to the prompt field.
What is the workaround for generating directly in RuinedFooocus?
The workaround for generating directly in RuinedFooocus is via wildcards, which can be used in conjunction with styles.
What are the One Button Prompt style wildcards available in RuinedFooocus?

The One Button Prompt style wildcards available in RuinedFooocus are __onebuttonprompt__, __onebuttonsubject__, __onebuttonhumanoid__, __onebuttonmale__, __onebuttonfemale__, __onebuttonanimal__, __onebuttonlandscape__, __onebuttonobject__, and __onebuttonconcept__.
How can the subject be overridden in One Button Prompt wildcards?

The subject can be overridden in One Button Prompt wildcards by typing the wildcard followed by a colon and the desired subject, such as __onebuttonprompt:daenerys targaryen__ or __onebuttonanimal:cute dog__.
What is the __onebuttonartist__ wildcard integration in RuinedFooocus?

The __onebuttonartist__ wildcard integration in RuinedFooocus runs the artist generation part of One Button Prompt. By default, it is similar to using the 'all' setting of artists, but it can be overridden by using __onebuttonartist:fantasy__ or __onebuttonartist:character__.
What is SuperPrompt?
SuperPrompt is a prompt model integrated into One Button Prompt, designed to generate longer, more readable prompts while still adhering to the One Button Prompt framework.
How does SuperPrompt work with One Button Prompt?
SuperPrompt takes the generated subject from One Button Prompt and uses it to generate additional descriptive content. This process doesn't alter the other stylings generated by One Button Prompt.
What is the purpose of using superpromptstyle?
superpromptstyle is used to set the styling of the prompt. All other settings such as temperature and top_p are controlled by the insanity slider.
Can OneButtonPrompt and Superprompt work with other tools?
Yes, they can be successfully coupled with tools like One Button Artify.
Can OneButtonPrompt and Superprompt generate simply artworks?
Yes, OneButtonPrompt uses __"subject only mode"__ to not add styling from One Button Prompt, which results in simpler artwork.
Is there an error related with OneButtonPrompt and Superprompt?

Yes, when OneButtonPrompt has issues with pickled file, it may not prompt the model to download. Instead, it can manually download the model files directly from Huggingface and place it in the correct directory.
How to configure OneButtonPrompt for Superprompt in A1111/SD.Next?
In A1111/SD.Next, locate the 'Prompt enhancer' option in the Advanced settings under prompts and set it to 'superprompt-v1'.
What is the purpose of the 'only templates' mode in OneButtonPrompt?

The 'only templates' mode in OneButtonPrompt forces the tool to generate prompts based on preconfigured templates instead of its normal randomized generation, which can be helpful for beginners to create prompts inspired by popular existing prompts.
What are prompt templates in OneButtonPrompt?

Prompt templates in OneButtonPrompt are preconfigured prompts that use wildcards to add randomization while still maintaining the essence of the original prompt. These templates are based on various popular existing prompts from sources like civitai, prompthero, promptbook, replicable, and openart.
How can a user add their own prompt templates to OneButtonPrompt?

A user can add their own prompt templates to OneButtonPrompt by placing a 'templates_addon.csv' or a 'templates_replace.csv' file in the 'userfiles' folder of the application, following the structure: prompt;source;sourcecategory;subjecttype;subjectwildcard.
How does the 'Subject Override' feature work with prompt templates in OneButtonPrompt?

The 'Subject Override' feature works with prompt templates by inserting the user-defined subject into the prompt templates, replacing the -subject- wildcard. However, the 'Smart subject' feature has no effect when using prompt templates.
Can you contribute your own prompt templates to OneButtonPrompt for others to use?
Yes, you can contribute your own prompt templates to OneButtonPrompt by either sending a message with the templates in the GitHub discussions or creating a pull request.
What determines the main category of a prompt template in OneButtonPrompt?
The 'subjecttype' field determines the main category of a prompt template in OneButtonPrompt, which can be 'object', 'animal', 'humanoid', 'landscape', or 'concept'.
How does OneButtonPrompt ensure diversity in its prompt templates?

OneButtonPrompt tries to have as much diversity as possible in the prompt templates set by including over 500+ prompt templates based on popular existing prompts from various sources. However, 'humanoids' are overrepresented, and 'concept' is underrepresented in the dataset.
What is the purpose of One Button Prompt?
One Button Prompt is a tool that generates prompts, which can be combined with other tools and extensions like IMG2IMG and ControlNET to create various image styles and variations.
Which model is used in the examples provided?
The examples provided use the deliberate model.
What settings were used for the Sampling method, Sampling steps, and CFG Scale in the examples?
The Sampling method was set to 'DPM++ SDE Karras', Sampling steps to '30', and the standard CFG Scale was set to '7'.
How was the skull image generated using IMG2IMG?

A picture of a skull with background noise was loaded in IMG2IMG with a Denoise strength of 0.75. One Button Prompt settings were adjusted to generate close-up skull portraits with various artistic styles and backgrounds.
How was the Stormtrooper helmet image generated using ControlNET?

ControlNET was configured with a Stormtrooper helmet image and set to use the 'Depth' model ('depth_midas'). The 'Ending Control Step' was set to 0.75, and 'My prompt is more important' was selected. One Button Prompt settings were adjusted to generate surprising images combining Stormtrooper helmets with various objects, artistic styles, and settings.
What is 'reverse inpainting' and how was it demonstrated on Pedro Pascal's face?

Reverse inpainting involves using One Button Prompt to replace everything but the masked area (in this case, Pedro Pascal's face). The photo was loaded in the Inpaint tab, the face was painted over, and 'Inpaint not masked' was turned on. The inpainting model used was realisticVision, and One Button Prompt settings were adjusted to generate portraits of Pedro Pascal with various styles, expressions, and accessories.
What is the key to unlocking the power of One Button Prompt?
The key to unlocking the power of One Button Prompt is the user's creativity, as it can be used in unexpected ways when combined with different tools and settings.
What are wildcards in OneButtonPrompt?
Wildcards in OneButtonPrompt are special placeholders that can be used in the prompt prefix, prompt suffix, and subject override fields. They get values from their specific related lists.
How can you use the -subjectfromfile- wildcard in OneButtonPrompt?

To use the -subjectfromfile- wildcard in OneButtonPrompt, you need to place a file called custom_subjects.csv in the user_files folder. When this wildcard is used, it will select a random value from the file, and it is suggested to be used in the Overwrite Subject field.
What is the relationship between OneButtonPrompt and the Dynamic Prompts extension?

The Dynamic Prompts extension can be considered the father of OneButtonPrompt, while StylePile is its mother. OneButtonPrompt can be combined with Dynamic Prompts, allowing the use of wildcards supported by Dynamic Prompts in the prompt prefix, prompt suffix, and subject override fields.
How does OneButtonPrompt support the Dynamic Prompts syntax?

OneButtonPrompt supports the Dynamic Prompts syntax of {cat|dog}, which allows switching during batch processing. This means that if you have managed your own wildcards before, you can use them in OneButtonPrompt as well, using the standard settings like __ __wildcardname__ __.
Can you provide an example of how to use OneButtonPrompt with the Dynamic Prompts extension?

Yes, an example is setting the Subject Types to "animal", Artists to "sci-fi" or "none", and Type of image to "digital art". Then, set the Overwrite subject to "cyberpunk __ __bird__ __ with -material- implants", using a bird.txt wildcard file in the appropriate directory. This will generate images of cyberpunk birds with various materials as implants.
How can you use the {cat|dog} basic usage syntax in OneButtonPrompt?

To use the {cat|dog} basic usage syntax in OneButtonPrompt, set the Subject Types to "animal", Artists to "sculpture", and Overwrite type of image to "sculpture". Then, set the Overwrite subject to "{cat|dog}" and run with multiple batches to see it switch between cat and dog sculptures.
What is the purpose of using wildcards and syntax like {cat|dog} in OneButtonPrompt?

The purpose of using wildcards and syntax like {cat|dog} in OneButtonPrompt is to add variety and flexibility to the generated images. It allows users to easily switch between different subjects, materials, and styles during batch processing, creating a diverse range of images with minimal effort.
What is the purpose of the Workflow Assist tab in OneButtonPrompt?
The main purpose of the Workflow Assist tab in OneButtonPrompt is to work on and refine prompts.
What are the three distinct parts of the Workflow Assist tab?

The three distinct parts of the Workflow Assist tab are: 1) The workflow prompt field and turning on workflow mode, 2) Creating a prompt variant with the Prompt variant slider, and 3) Generating a set of prompts with a button.
How can you generate random prompts in the Workflow Assist tab?

In the Workflow Assist tab, you can generate random prompts by scrolling down and pressing the 'Generate me some prompts!' button. This will generate 5 prompts, and you can keep pressing the button to get new prompts.
How do you send a generated prompt to the workflow prompt field in OneButtonPrompt?
To send a generated prompt to the workflow prompt field, you can use the 'Send prompt up' button next to the generated prompt.
How do you activate the workflow prompt mode in OneButtonPrompt?

To activate the workflow prompt mode in OneButtonPrompt, you need to turn on 'Workflow mode'. This will use whatever is in the prompt field for the image generation process instead of the normal OneButtonPrompt generation process.
What does the prompt variant slider in OneButtonPrompt do?

The prompt variant slider in OneButtonPrompt creates variants of the workflow prompt. It determines how many alternate universes away it should take the prompt from, essentially creating slightly alternative prompts.
How does increasing the prompt variance level affect the generated prompts?

Increasing the prompt variance level creates more varied prompts. The bigger the number, the more varied the prompt. For example, at level 10, the generated prompts may have almost nothing resembling the original prompt, but can still give good results.
